item.title: 特朗普计划利用拜登的绿色银行提供数十亿美元贷款
item.description: 根据政府 2026 财年预算申请的详细内容，特朗普政府计划利用总统曾试图扼杀的 4000 亿美元绿色银行，为核反应堆、地热发电和关键矿产提供数十亿美元的贷款。【原文：The Trump administration plans to use a $400 billion green bank the president once sought to kill to finance billions of dollars in loans for nuclear reactors, geothermal power and critical minerals, according to details of the administration’s fiscal year 2026 budget request.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省野火导致加拿大约 7% 的石油生产停产
item.description: 加拿大能源中心地带阿尔伯塔省的野火导致该省近 35 万桶重质原油日产量停产，约占全国产量的 7%。【原文：Wildfires in Canada’s energy heartland of Alberta have shut down almost 350,000 barrels of daily heavy crude production — about 7% of the country’s output — as a major blaze near the province’s eastern border menaces oil sands operations.】

item.title: 意大利埃特纳火山爆发，腾起大量浓烟
item.description: 意大利埃特纳火山周一爆发，腾起大量烟雾，游客纷纷躲避。【原文：Italy’s Mount Etna erupted Monday, setting off large clouds of smoke and causing tourists to seek shelter.】

item.title: 法国修订海上风电场合同以缓解电力过剩问题
item.description: 法国政府与三家海上风力发电场签署了购电协议修正案，允许它们在负价格期间削减部分或全部产量。【原文：The French government and three offshore wind power farms signed amendments to power-purchase agreements, allowing them to curtail part or all of their production during periods of negative prices.】

item.title: 燃烧的道路、入侵的章鱼预示着炎热的夏季即将到来
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注北半球即将到来的夏季，以及气候变化带来的各种令人不安、令人惊讶和奇怪的影响。请继续阅读，或在彭博网站上了解有关烘烤公路、新员工高温法和英国章鱼入侵的完整故事。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the summer ahead for the Northern Hemisphere and all of the troubling, surprising and weird impacts climate change is creating. item.title: 加拿大大火产生的烟雾正在英国上空弥漫
item.description: 在加拿大燃烧的大规模野火产生的烟雾已经越过大西洋，吹到了英国上空。【原文：Smoke from massive wildfires burning in Canada has crossed the Atlantic Ocean and is blowing over the UK.】

item.title: 特朗普计划卸载国家公园用地，但各州却不想要
item.description:
白宫希望通过将一些公园移交给州和部落管理来削减国家公园管理局的预算。各州说他们的资源已经很紧张了。【原文：

The White House wants to trim the National Park Service budget by transferring some parks to state and tribal management. States say their resources are already tight.

】

item.title: 日本要求企业保护工人免受热浪侵袭，否则将被罚款
item.description:
在 2024 年员工受到酷暑影响后，国家政府出台了更严厉的法律。【原文：

The nation’s government has unveiled tougher legislation after employees were impacted by fierce summer temperatures in 2024.

】

item.title: 华氏 158 度的高温预示着从中国到美国的炎热夏季
item.description:
未来几个月的酷热天气可能会给电网带来压力，使农作物枯萎，并造成数十亿美元的经济损失。【原文：

Extreme heat in the coming months threatens to tax power grids, wilt crops and inflict billions of dollars in economic losses.

】

item.title: 加拿大野火迫使油砂区居民撤离，石油运输中断
item.description: 加拿大西部野火肆虐，迫使成千上万人逃离家园，现在也促使人们撤离阿尔伯塔省北部的油砂项目。【原文：Raging Western Canadian wildfires that have forced thousands of people from their homes are now also prompting evacuations from oilsands projects in northern Alberta.】

item.title: Meyer Burger 因两家公司申请破产而推迟发布财报
item.description: 陷入困境的太阳能模块制造商 Meyer Burger Technology AG 在其德国子公司申请破产程序后，要求延长提交 2024 年财务报告的最后期限。【原文：Struggling solar-module manufacturer Meyer Burger Technology AG requested an extension of the deadline to present its 2024 financial results after its German units filed for insolvency proceedings.】

item.title: 气温达到 26 摄氏度，英国有史以来最晴朗的春季温暖落幕
item.description: 周六，英国气温达到 26 摄氏度，在英国正式进入夏季之前，结束了有记录以来最晴朗的春季。【原文：UK temperatures hit 26C on Saturday, wrapping up the sunniest spring on record before the country officially goes into the summer season.】

item.title: 尼日利亚洪灾已确认至少 151 人死亡
item.description: 尼日利亚阿布贾（美联社）— 当地紧急服务部门周六告诉美联社，尼日利亚中北部一个集镇因暴雨引发洪灾，目前已确认至少有 151 人死亡。【原文：ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) — At least 151 people have now been confirmed dead after heavy rainfall unleashed flooding in a market town in north-central Nigeria, the local emergency services told The Associated Press on Saturday.】

item.title: 特朗普紧急命令停止关闭第二家发电厂
item.description: 在宾夕法尼亚州的发电厂原定关闭的前一天，特朗普政府第二次援引紧急权力，命令另一家发电厂继续运营。【原文：The Trump administration ordered another power plant to remain operational by invoking emergency powers for a second time, a day before the facility in Pennsylvania was scheduled to close.】

item.title: 在不稳定天气到来之前，英国气温可能达到 27 华氏度
item.description: 在英国有史以来阳光最充足的春季的最后一个周末，周六的气温可能会达到 27 摄氏度，而下周的天气预计会多变。【原文：Temperatures could hit 27C on Saturday during the final weekend of the sunniest UK spring on record, before changeable weather is forecast next week.】

item.title: 特朗普官员将与亚洲领导人就阿拉斯加能源问题举行会谈
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普总统鼓励其他国家从阿拉斯加边疆州购买天然气，近二十多名外国官员将与美国政府高层领导一起参加以阿拉斯加能源资源为主题的会议。【原文：Almost two dozen foreign officials are set to join top US government leaders in meetings focused on Alaska’s energy resources, as President Donald Trump encourages other nations to buy natural gas from the Frontier State.】

item.title: 用鹰嘴豆和大麦制作的 "咖啡 "如何比较
item.description:
另类咖啡生产商表示，随着气候变化导致普通咖啡豆供应越来越少、价格越来越高，使用蘑菇和鹰嘴豆等配料制作的混合咖啡将赢得更多市场份额。【原文：

Alternative coffee producers say blends made with ingredients like mushrooms and chickpeas will gain market share as regular bean supplies become scarcer and more expensive due to climate change.

】

item.title: 特朗普将取消 37 亿美元的清洁能源项目
item.description: 能源部正在取消约 37 亿美元的政府对清洁能源项目的支持，该部称，这些项目不值得特朗普政府继续支持。【原文：The Energy Department is canceling some $3.7 billion in government support for clean energy projects it said did not warrant continued backing from the Trump administration.】

item.title: 特朗普延长老煤电厂寿命引发 "紧急 "行动辩论
item.description: 特朗普政府上周下达紧急命令，延长本周末面临永久关闭的一家老旧煤电厂的寿命，这让专家们感到困惑，也激怒了清洁能源倡导者。【原文：The Trump administration’s emergency order last week to extend the life of an aging coal plant that faced permanent closure this weekend is baffling experts and enraging clean-power advocates.】

item.description:

Another dose of weekend precipitation will be followed by sunnier skies.

item.title: 新加坡批准从印尼进口 1GW 太阳能产品
item.description: 新加坡向从印度尼西亚进口高达 1 千兆瓦的太阳能电力迈出了一步，这也是这个小城市国家通过跨境联系加强能源安全的努力的一部分。【原文：Singapore took a step toward importing up to 1 gigawatt of solar power from Indonesia, part of the tiny city-state’s efforts to shore up energy security via cross-border links.】

item.title: 石油巨头就新加坡碳运输招标
item.description: 由石油巨头埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）和壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）牵头在新加坡开展的碳捕集项目正在就气体的运输和储存进行招标，这是该国限制工业排放努力的一部分。【原文：A carbon capture project in Singapore led by oil giants Exxon Mobil Corp. and Shell Plc is seeking bids for transport and storage of the gas, as part of the country’s efforts to limit industrial emissions.】

item.title: 中国加强云层播种，为干旱麦区增雨
item.description: 就在农民加速收割庄稼之际，中国加强了天气调节措施，以增加该国北部干涸的小麦种植区的降雨量。【原文：China has ramped up weather modification measures to bolster rainfall across parched wheat-growing areas in the north of the country, just as farmers accelerate the harvesting of their crops.】

item.title: 英吉利海峡的章鱼入侵昭示海洋热浪风险
item.description: 一些英国渔民在本季收获颇丰，捕获了数吨章鱼，但八足软体动物的入侵也凸显了海洋热浪的威胁。【原文：Some English fisherman have hit the jackpot this season, hauling in tons of octopus, but the invasion of eight-legged molluscs also highlights the threat from marine heat waves.】

item.title: 沙特公用事业公司希望在马来西亚开展价值 100 亿美元的可再生能源项目
item.description: 沙特公用事业公司 Acwa 电力公司与马来西亚公司签署了不具约束力的协议，包括探讨到 2040 年开发约 13 千兆瓦的发电能力，投资总额达 100 亿美元。【原文：Saudi utility Acwa Power Co. signed non-binding agreements with Malaysian firms, including to explore development of about 13 gigawatts of power generation capacity, totaling $10 billion in investments by 2040.】

item.title: NuScale 小型核反应堆设计获美国批准
item.description: NuScale Power Corp. 是美国唯一一家获准建造小型核反应堆的公司，该公司的第二款设计目前已获得监管部门的支持，可能在本十年末投入使用。【原文：NuScale Power Corp., the only company with US approval for a small nuclear reactor, has now won regulatory support for a second design that may go into service by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 西班牙大停电指责游戏升温，Iberdrola 将矛头指向电网
item.description: 西班牙电网运营商和该国最大的公用事业公司就其在该国有史以来最大停电事故中所扮演的角色进行了公开指责。【原文：Spain’s grid operator and the country’s largest utility took to public finger-wagging over their roles during the country’s biggest-ever blackout.】
